Articles.Content:
I’m constructing my solar commnet, and am currently at Duna. I need precise orbital info, unfortunately, it just shows me LOCKED.

I would expect this with bad signal or a weaker probe core, but i’m using the 2.5m one and my signal strength is 96% bouncing through Relay 3, 2, and my refueling/comms station before going to the KSC. It says unloaded on them which I imagine doesn’t make much of an impact, but I don’t know.

Edited February 5, 2022 by Wizard Kerbal
It’s spread to all my vessels, and restarting KSP didn’t fix it.

Screenshot?

Sounds like this save might be corrupted, try loading an earlier one?

i guess, since you are sending probes to comet, that you did upgrade the tracking station long since.

but it could be a related bug. I have a career where sometimes it thinks my astronaut complex is level 1 (even though it's 3) and is forbidding me from going eva.

in my case, i did discover that restarting and reloading the game works. Not just restarting the game, and not just reloading. I must save the game manually, then restart the game, when I enter the game in the ksc I must then reload the game where i was driving my rover, and then it let me go eva. if I move to the rover from the tracking station, i still get the bug. if I reload the game without restarting, i still get the bug
